information:
Chris Stapleton received six nominations for the 60th Academy of Country Music Awards. His nominations are for Male Artist of the Year, Entertainer of the Year, Album of the Year, Single of the Year, Music Event of the Year (with Carly Pearce), and Visual Media of the Year. Other top nominees include Ella Langley with eight nominations, and Cody Johnson and Morgan Wallen, who are tied with seven nominations each. Lainey Wilson also received six nominations.

Chris Stapleton has a history of success at industry awards. He has won 19 ACM Awards and 19 CMA Awards throughout his career. In November 2024, at the CMA Awards, he won four awards, including single and song of the year for 'White Horse' and was named male vocalist of the year for a record-extending eighth time. In February 2025, he won his 11th career Grammy Award for Best Country Solo Performance for the song 'It Takes A Woman'.

The 60th Academy of Country Music Awards are scheduled to take place on May 8, 2025, streaming live from the Ford Center at The Star in Frisco, Texas. Reba McEntire will host the event for the 18th time. The lineup of performers announced for the ceremony includes Chris Stapleton and Dua Lipa.

forecast.time_left_until_outcome_known: 16 days (the 60th Academy of Country Music Awards are scheduled for May 8, 2025)
forecast.status_quo_outcome: Yes - Chris Stapleton wins at least one award
forecast.no_outcome_scenario: Chris Stapleton loses in all 6 categories he's nominated in, with votes splitting among the strong competition including Ella Langley (8 nominations), Cody Johnson and Morgan Wallen (7 nominations each), and Lainey Wilson (6 nominations). The Academy could favor newer artists or spread recognition across multiple performers.
forecast.yes_outcome_scenario: Chris Stapleton wins at least one of his 6 nominations (Male Artist of the Year, Entertainer of the Year, Album of the Year, Single of the Year, Music Event of the Year, or Visual Media of the Year), continuing his dominant run at country music awards.
forecast.rationale: The evidence strongly supports a Yes outcome. Stapleton has 6 nominations at the 60th ACM Awards, which gives him multiple opportunities to win. His recent track record is exceptional: he won 4 CMA Awards in November 2024 including Male Vocalist of the Year for a record 8th time and awards for 'White Horse', plus he won his 11th Grammy in February 2025. With 19 ACM Awards already in his career, he's a proven winner at this specific ceremony. The status quo clearly points to him winning, as the more nominations an artist has, the higher the probability of winning at least one. While there is strong competition from artists with multiple nominations like Ella Langley, the historical pattern and recent momentum make it very likely he wins at least one award. My forecast is not higher (90%+) because awards voting can be unpredictable, votes could split across many nominees, and the Academy might choose to spread recognition. It's not lower (75% or below) because with 6 nominations and such dominant recent performance, it would be statistically unusual for him to be completely shut out. To revise upward, I'd need to see evidence of strong voting momentum or insider predictions favoring him. To revise downward, I'd need evidence that voters might favor newer artists or that his nominations are in particularly competitive categories where he's an underdog.

prompt:
You are a professional forecaster interviewing for a job.

Your interview question is:
Will Chris Stapleton win an award at the 60th Academy of Country Music Awards?

Question background:
The awards are scheduled to be held on May 8, 2025. Stapleton has 5 nominations.


This question's outcome will be determined by the specific criteria below. These criteria have not yet been satisfied:
This question resolves as **Yes** if Chris Stapleton wins an award at the [60th Academy of Country Music Awards](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/60th_Academy_of_Country_Music_Awards).




Your research assistant's report says:
Chris Stapleton received six nominations for the 60th Academy of Country Music Awards. His nominations are for Male Artist of the Year, Entertainer of the Year, Album of the Year, Single of the Year, Music Event of the Year (with Carly Pearce), and Visual Media of the Year. Other top nominees include Ella Langley with eight nominations, and Cody Johnson and Morgan Wallen, who are tied with seven nominations each. Lainey Wilson also received six nominations.

Chris Stapleton has a history of success at industry awards. He has won 19 ACM Awards and 19 CMA Awards throughout his career. In November 2024, at the CMA Awards, he won four awards, including single and song of the year for 'White Horse' and was named male vocalist of the year for a record-extending eighth time. In February 2025, he won his 11th career Grammy Award for Best Country Solo Performance for the song 'It Takes A Woman'.

The 60th Academy of Country Music Awards are scheduled to take place on May 8, 2025, streaming live from the Ford Center at The Star in Frisco, Texas. Reba McEntire will host the event for the 18th time. The lineup of performers announced for the ceremony includes Chris Stapleton and Dua Lipa.

Today is 2025-04-22.

Before answering you think:
(a) The time left until the outcome to the question is known.
(b) The status quo outcome if nothing changed.
(c) A brief description of a scenario that results in a No outcome.
(d) A brief description of a scenario that results in a Yes outcome.
(e) You write your rationale remembering that good forecasters put extra weight on the status quo outcome since the world changes slowly most of the time. Explain your reasoning and the evidence behind your forecast in detail. Summarise information your received from your research assistant that influences your forecast (if any). Explain why your forecast is not higher, and why it is not lower. Outline what would need to be true for you to update your forecast in either direction.
(f) The last thing you write is your final probabilistic forecast as a number between 0 and 100.

# OUTPUT SCHEMA
{
    "time_left_until_outcome_known": "string",
    "status_quo_outcome": "string",
    "no_outcome_scenario": "string",
    "yes_outcome_scenario": "string",
    "rationale": "string",
    "probability": "number" (0-100)
}
